segments.text: If cottage cheese has not won you over
yet, this may just be the recipe that
changes your mind because I am making a
rich, decadent, delicious double
chocolate mousse using cottage cheese as
the base. And I am telling you, it is
delicious. If we have not met yet, my
name is Danny Spees. I am a health,
weight loss, and eating psychology coach
who loves to make healthy eating feel
easy while helping you build a mindset
and a lifestyle that supports your
goals. Now, I have to tell you, this
recipe is so simple and it's so good.
You only need four ingredients. You need
some cottage cheese. Then, I have some
cocoa powder, a little bit of vanilla
extract, and then some chocolate chips.
Now, all of this is going to happen
right in a blender or a food processor.
Personally, I like using a food
processor because I find it's easier to
scoop the mousse out at the end. So,
either would work. A blender will get
the job done. Just a quick side note on
food processors. If you're looking to
invest in a food processor, little
inside tip for you, look for one that
has a 4 cup capacity because a lot of
the mini processors are three cup and
that extra cup makes a big difference.
So, if you're looking for one, I will of
course link the one that I'm using here
down in the description box below. So,
the first thing in, we're going to add
our cottage cheese. You need 1 cup plus
2 tbsp, which is ultimately equivalent
to 250 g of cottage cheese. And you're
going to get that right into your
processor. Now, you can do this with a
low-fat cottage cheese or you can do
this with a full fat cottage cheese. I
have tried both and I'm going to tell
you, they're both delicious. The biggest
difference is if you use a low fat, the
mousse ends up having a little bit more
of like a pudding-like texture. Whereas
if if you use the full fat, it's a
little bit richer. So now we're kind of
more in mousse territory. Okay. Then
I've got some cocoa powder about 1 and
1/2 tablespoons. That's going right in.
And then a bit of vanilla extract.
Okay. Now, because we're making double
chocolate mousse, we need another source
of chocolate. And that's going to be our
chocolate chips. Um, you do want to melt
them first. So, I'm going to pop these
in the microwave just for about 20 30
seconds and then we'll stir them up and
get them in. Quick uh tip. When you're
melting chocolate chips in the
microwave, you want to take them out
when you can still see the shapes of
some of the chips, but you can see that
they're softened because when you start
to mix it, you'll see that they are
ready to just blend right in. And if you
were to leave it in the microwave for
too long, you could scorch it. So, look
for soft
um but still with a little bit of shape.
And you'll see it stirs right up into
some melted chocolate.
Okay. Once you've got it nice and smooth
and silky, it goes right into
the food processor
with the rest of the ingredients. Now,
because the intention of this is to make
a protein forward, lower sugar dessert,
I like to use the Lily chocolate chips.
It's basically a chocolate chip that has
no added sugar. So, it's little tweaks
like that that can really add up in the
kitchen. And I have to say, they are
rather delicious.
Okay,
this is them. Actually, if you want to
see them, this is what they look like.
This bag's open, but that's what they
look like. That's what the bag looks
like. Now, if you know that you like a
sweeter dessert, you can also add one or
two tablespoons of maple syrup here or a
couple squirts of stevia, that would
totally work. I have done that before.
And kind of the way I roll is if I'm
making this for myself on a Tuesday cuz
I have a little bit of a sweet tooth,
I'll usually make it with a low-fat
cottage cheese and I'll skip the extra
sweetener. If I'm making it like for a
family dessert or for the holidays, then
I will go with the full fat cottage
cheese, a little bit richer, and I might
add one or two tablespoons of maple
syrup. It just kind of brings it all to
the next level. But I have to say, both
versions are delicious. Okay. From here,
you're just going to pop on the lid to
your food processor. I got to make sure

is. Okay.
And then we're going to blend it back
and forth
until it looks smooth and creamy. And I
like to alternate in both directions. So
I'll do like 20 seconds in one

Okay. Once it starts to come together, I
like to open it up and then I'll just
scrape the sides down and then do it
again cuz she is very rich. I mean, it
really looks just like a thick almost
like a ganache. Again, this was the full
fat cottage cheese I'm using right now.
So, she's a little bit thicker. Very
fun. With the holidays coming up, you
could always like make something like
this, but don't tell people what the
secret ingredient is. I used to do this
with my um my avocado um chocolate
pudding and let them eat and enjoy and
then see if they can guess what the
secret ingredient was.
Okay.
Okay. This is looking really good.
you're going to know you've arrived
because again, it's going to look thick
and silky and delicious and you're not
going to see little white bits
throughout. So then what you want to do
is put it in your containers. I love and
highly recommend these little mason
jars. They're 4 oz each, but they are
the perfect size. And what I have here
today is going to make two servings.
Okay. So, what I personally like to do
is let's move this out of the way
is grab a big spoon and then I just go
back and forth to try to make look even.
Right. So, we'll do Oh, look at this
texture. OMG. Can you see how this
texture? It is like silky,
smooth,
creamy, rich, decadent, delicious. And
once you pop this in the fridge and you
let it set up, it gets even thicker and
more delicious. And I have one I'm going
to show you in a minute. So,
we'll just get these in our jars like
this. And then you can always pick it
up,
give it a little tap,
just get any of those air pockets out.
And again, not only are these gorgeous
and perfect for the holidays, but if you
are working on health goals, weight loss
goals, fitness goals, and you find
yourself sometimes with a sweet tooth,
this is the perfect fix. And I often
say, you know, it's not only about, oh,
trying to make a lighter dessert, it's
about thinking about the ingredients
that are going into your desserts
because we want to think beyond the
moment that we're eating those desserts.
Meaning, does that dessert satisfy you?
and leave you content and happy to walk
out of the kitchen or do those desserts
drive more sugar cravings? And a lot of
times when you're having like a lot of
processed flowers or sugars in your
desserts, you eat them, you enjoy them,
but then you crave more of them. where
often when you're when you do little
tweaks like this and you're having
something that's more protein forward,
lower sugar, it can really not only be
delicious and satisfying, but it curbs
the cravings so you are satisfied and

right, so once I've got both of my jars

and then you would just put these in the

and I'm going to show you the texture.
Okay. So, once it has set up in the

yesterday. You're going to see how rich.
Can you see this texture? How rich and
thick. It's like a chocolate mousse. I
mean, it is insane.
So, you can eat it just like this, which
we're going to do in a second. Or if you
want, you could give it a little little

you could do a little fresh whipped
cream. And then you could do chocolate
chips, chocolate shavings. I happen to
have some of these cacao nibs in my
pantry, which I haven't been eating, so
I thought this was the perfect time to
use them. It's basically unsweetened
chocolate in raw form. So, it's not
sugary, but it's got that rich depth of
cocoa flavor. Nice little crunch. So,
how cute is that? Right. And it's an
individual serving. You just get your
little spoon in there. Let's give it a
go.
My
if you have not jumped on, if I couldn't
convince you with cottage cheese bagels
and cottage cheese alfredo and cottage
cheese bologns, maybe I can convince you
with cottage cheese mousse because I am
telling you, this is to die for. I'm so

All of these links for you are down in

And if you enjoy simple, healthy recipes
